channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: It's an American special as Jeremy, Richard and James try to prove that a fly-drive holiday to Florida would be more fun if you bought a car instead of renting one. Having picked up some wheels for no more than $1,000 each, the boys embark on an epic road trip to find out who got the best deal, encountering heat, flies and very angry locals along the way.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the islands of the Aegean to Greece's capital, Athens. To learn more about Greece and the Greeks, he meets an extraordinary cast of characters, from gun-toting priests to the last remaining sponge divers. Getting behind the postcard image of this beautiful country, he finds out how the Greeks are coming to terms with a seemingly endless crisis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With rockers Wet Leg, legendary band Sparks, Italian composer Ludovico Einaudi, south London/Colombian singer Sasha Keable, LA singer Annahstasia, and Scottish artist Brooke Combe. Concluding the line up are three voices.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With girl group Sugababes, London rockers Wolf Alice, wordsmith Kae Tempest, Nigerian-born Obongjayar, Donegal's George Houston, and folk legend Peggy Seeger.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Respect
channel.desc: Aretha Franklin sings in her father's church choir as a child and grows up to become an international musical superstar and legend.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Question Time
channel.desc: Features a studio audience quizzing top politicians on the events of the day. The panel surrounding presenter Fiona Bruce is composed of at least one member of the three major parties.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Not Going Out
channel.desc: Lee and Lucy view a property that Lucy loves when, embarrassingly, Lee needs the loo. Before he can use it however, a second buyer turns up to take a look, making Lee pretend to be a vendor.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of mouthwatering recipes from Ching-He Huang, Georgina Hayden, Shauna Froydenlund and Tom Parker-Bowles. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers journey across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: Chris and Michaela reveal more wildlife wonders at the Longshaw Estate, Iolo's urban adventure continues in Belfast, and Megan meets some of the nocturnal residents of Haddon Hall.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: It's the men's turn to take centre stage at London's famous venue as the top male players battle it out in what's likely to be their final tournament ahead of Wimbledon. An all-star entry list includes reigning Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz, British number one Jack Draper and American big-hitter Taylor Fritz. In 2024, the USA's Tommy Paul defeated Italy's Lorenzo Musetti in the final, with Paul returning this year to defend his title. Clare Balding presents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson spends time with old friend and actor Kevin Whately. They reminisce about growing up in North East England before heading to Alnmouth beach to try their hands at making pictures in the sand at low tide.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Earth's Great Rivers
channel.desc: The Mississippi, from frozen waterfalls to time-travelling barges, from busy beavers to mysterious swamps, connects a continent like no other river. At the end of its 3,500-mile journey, it creates one of the biggest river deltas on the planet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Steph and her two children live in St Annes near Blackpool. Recently divorced, Steph is excited about making a fresh start by transforming her garden. It's currently a dilapidated outside space, mostly enveloped by shade.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: A quiet estate in Shrewsbury is the scene of a horrific killing when 23-year-old delivery driver Aurman Singh is ambushed and fatally assaulted in broad daylight. West Mercia Police begin a major manhunt to track down his killers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Upstart Crow
channel.desc: Will has finished writing `Romeo and Juliet' but now there is competition for who will play Juliet. Kate feels the part should be hers, but lady-acting is against the law, and Burbage and Condell may no longer look like young teenage lovers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: After racing nearly 13,000 kilometres over seven weeks through China, Nepal and India, the four teams are about to embark on the final leg of the race. As the race comes to an end, the teams take a moment to reflect on their experiences.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Pitzhanger Manor and Gallery in Ealing, West London, where treasures include a royal paintbox, a stylish collection of Italian jewellery, and a rare wartime medal awarded to a carrier pigeon. Frances Christie is thrilled to find a moving work by eminent 20th-century sculptor Dame Elisabeth Frink, while a couple of eerie Victorian cut-out figures, known as 'dummy boards', bring a smile to Mark Hill's face.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: A short distance from the auction in Royal Wootton Bassett, Eric Knowles finds himself on a hillside, marvelling at the Hackpen White Horse. At the antiques fair in Exeter, two teams hope to carve out profits, helped by Izzie Balmer and Serhat Ahmet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Flo and Lee are in Bristol to create a garden for Emi and Song that draws on their combined Japanese heritage and love of the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Extraordinary Portraits
channel.desc: Bill Bailey challenges a young artist to paint Marva and Lionel, who have fostered almost 200 teenagers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Alison Hammond's Big Weekend
channel.desc: Alison Hammond spends a big weekend with Sir Lenny Henry, discussing his career, early fame and complex childhood, from losing his mother to discovering his biological father.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from London's iconic tennis venue as the first round of 2025's men's tournament continues at Queen's Club. The opening round provided mixed fortunes for home hopes in 2024, with Jack Draper and Andy Murray, on his final appearance, making it through. Cameron Norrie, however, was beaten in a thrilling match by 2016 Wimbledon finalist Milos Raonic, while Dan Evans was forced to retire against Brandon Nakashima. Clare Balding presents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is reunited with acting pal Angela Lonsdale in the Northumberland countryside. Angela lets Robson introduce her to wild swimming at Sweethope Lough under the watchful eye of Team GB cold-water swimmer Fenwick Ridley.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Villages by the Sea
channel.desc: Ben Robinson finds evidence of early pilgrimage at a remarkable Norman priory. In a 500-year-old house in the village, the archaeologist examines a wall mural that proves it was the birthplace of an important Elizabethan archbishop.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nigella: Cook, Eat, Repeat
channel.desc: Nigella debates whether one should meddle with classics. She thinks that in the case of her crab mac`n'cheese, it's a must. If the sight of glorious melted cheese isn't enough, fear not, as she follows it with her `mine all mine chocolate cookies'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood are in a vintage Land Rover Series 2 as they scour every nook, cranny and dusty shelf in Hampshire for treasures to sell at auction. They're joined on their journey by Irita Marriott and David Harper.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI
channel.desc: More of the best moments from the U series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with Alan and their guests.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Small Town, Big Riot
channel.desc: Mobeen Azhar investigates how a protest outside an asylum seeker hotel turned into a riot, uncovering a blueprint for a national wave of violence that eight months later would affect us all.
